<<>>: PrintWriter.write <<>>: ```java InputStreamReader reader = null; try{ File file = new File("C:\\Users\\ваня\\Desktop\\asksearch\\" + list[i]); reader = new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream(file), "UTF-8"); BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(reader); int lineCount = 0; String line; PrintWriter wr = response.getWriter(); wr.print(""); wr.print(""); wr.print("HelloWorld"); wr.print(""); wr.print(""); while((line = br.readLine()) != null) { wr.write("
"); wr.write(line); wr.write("
"); if(++lineCount == 2) break; } wr.write("
"); wr.print(""); wr.print(""); wr.close(); } ``` <<>>: In this code, we are using the PrintWriter.write API to write the contents of the file to the response. We first create an InputStreamReader to read the file, and then wrap it in a BufferedReader to read the file line by line. We then create a PrintWriter to write the response. We start by writing the HTML header, and then we enter a while loop where we read each line from the file and write it to the response inside a div tag. We keep a count of the lines we have read, and once we have read the first two lines, we break out of the loop. Finally, we write the HTML footer and close the PrintWriter.
